Harlem, GA Population by Race & Ethnicity

Racial distribution of Harlem population: 68.01% are white, 27.21% are Black or African American, 0.76% are some other race and 4.02% are multiracial.

By Neilsberg Research

Updated Jul 15, 2024

Harlem, GA population by race

The table below shows Harlem's population by race.

Race Population % of Total Population White 2,504 68.01% Black or African American 1,002 27.21% American Indian and Alaska Native 0 - Asian 0 - Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander 0 - Some other race 28 0.76% Two or more races (multiracial) 148 4.02%

TABLE OF CONTENTS

Harlem population by race

Of the 5 race categories (excluding ethnicity) identified by the Census Bureau, namely American Indian or Alaska Native, Asian, Black or African American, Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander and White; Harlem has a population in 4 of the race categories.

This confirms that Harlem's population is moderately diverse.

The percent distribution of Harlem population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 68.01% are white, 27.21% are Black or African American, 0.76% are some other race and 4.02% are multiracial.

FIGURE 1

Harlem, GA population by race.

The largest racial group in Harlem is White with a population of 2,504 (68.01% of the total population).

Harlem 's racial breakdown clearly shows that there is an absolute majority (i.e. more than 50% of the population belong to one particular race) of White population in the city.

As per the latest data estimates from American Community Survey's 5-year estimates:

1. The largest racial group in Harlem is White with a population of 2,504 (68.01% of the total population).

2. The multiracial population, i.e. population that identify themselves with two or more races , is 148 (4.02% of the total population).

Racial / Ethnic makeup of Harlem, GA

By ethnicity, 67 (1.82% of the total population) is Hispanic or Latino (of any race), and 3,615 (98.18% of the total population) is Non-Hispanic.

Of the Non-Hispanic population in Harlem, the largest racial group is White alone with a population of 2,482 (68.66% of the total Non-Hispanic population).

FIGURE 2

Harlem, GA Non-Hispanic population by race

All percentages shown below are, % of Harlem's Non-Hispanic population.

Harlem Non-Hispanic population by race

The distribution of the Non-Hispanic population across various race categories

Race Population % of Total Non-Hispanic Population White alone 2,482 68.66% Black or African American alone 1,002 27.72% American Indian and Alaska Native alone 0 0.00% Asian alone 0 0.00% Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone 0 0.00% Some other race alone 0 0.00% Two or more races (multiracial) 131 3.62%

Among the Hispanic population in Harlem, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 67 (100% of the total Hispanic population).

FIGURE 3

Harlem, GA Hispanic or Latino population

All percentages shown below are, % of Harlem's Hispanic population.

References

U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates

Notes

The analysis presented in this article is based on estimates derived from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey. While these figures offer valuable insights, they are subject to a margin of error. It is advisable to exercise caution and consider the potential margin of error when interpreting and utilizing this data.

Datasets

Explore datasets by year of publication.

2024

Harlem, GA Population Breakdown By Race (Excluding Ethnicity) Dataset: Population Counts and Percentages for 7 Racial Categories as Identified by the US Census Bureau // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the population of Harlem by race. It includes the population of Harlem across racial categories (excluding ethnicity) as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the population distribution of Harlem across relevant racial categories.

Key observations

The percent distribution of Harlem population by race (across all racial categories recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau): 68.01% are white, 27.21% are Black or African American, 0.76% are some other race and 4.02% are multiracial.

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Racial categories include:

White

Black or African American

American Indian and Alaska Native

Asian

Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander

Some other race

Two or more races (multiracial)

Variables / Data Columns

Race: This column displays the racial categories (excluding ethnicity) for the Harlem

Population: The population of the racial category (excluding ethnicity) in the Harlem is shown in this column.

% of Total Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each race as a proportion of Harlem total population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know

Margin of Error

Data in the dataset are based on the estimates and are subject to sampling variability and thus a margin of error. Neilsberg Research recommends using caution when presening these estimates in your research.

Custom data

If you do need custom data for any of your research project, report or presentation, you can contact our research staff at research@neilsberg.com for a feasibility of a custom tabulation on a fee-for-service basis.

Inspiration

Neilsberg Research Team curates, analyze and publishes demographics and economic data from a variety of public and proprietary sources, each of which often includes multiple surveys and programs. The large majority of Neilsberg Research aggregated datasets and insights is made available for free download at https://www.neilsberg.com/research/.

Key observations

Of the Non-Hispanic population in Harlem, the largest racial group is White alone with a population of 2,482 (68.66% of the total Non-Hispanic population).

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Racial categories include:

White

Black or African American

American Indian and Alaska Native

Asian

Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander

Some other race

Two or more races (multiracial)

Variables / Data Columns

Harlem, GA Hispanic or Latino Population Distribution by Ancestries Dataset : Detailed Breakdown of Hispanic or Latino Origins // 2024 Edition

Last updated July 7, 2024

About this dataset

Context

The dataset tabulates the Harlem Hispanic or Latino population. It includes the distribution of the Hispanic or Latino population, of Harlem, by their ancestries, as identified by the Census Bureau. The dataset can be utilized to understand the origin of the Hispanic or Latino population of Harlem.

Key observations

Among the Hispanic population in Harlem, regardless of the race, the largest group is of Mexican origin, with a population of 67 (100% of the total Hispanic population).

Content

When available, the data consists of estimates from the U.S. Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS) 2018-2022 5-Year Estimates.

Origin for Hispanic or Latino population include:

Mexican

Puerto Rican

Cuban

Other Hispanic or Latino

Variables / Data Columns

Origin: This column displays the origin for Hispanic or Latino population for the Harlem

Population: The population of the specific origin for Hispanic or Latino population in the Harlem is shown in this column.

% of Total Hispanic Population: This column displays the percentage distribution of each Hispanic origin as a proportion of Harlem total Hispanic or Latino population. Please note that the sum of all percentages may not equal one due to rounding of values.

Good to know

Margin of Error

Data in the dataset are based on the estimates and are subject to sampling variability and thus a margin of error. Neilsberg Research recommends using caution when presening these estimates in your research.
